meanings.definition: A person or thing that starts.
meanings.sent1: The starters in a race line up at the beginning.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the class who the starters were for the project.
meanings.sent3: The starters for the relay race were all eager to begin.
meanings.sent4: As the starters of the marathon, they set off with determination.
meanings.sent5: The starters of the concert were the youngest musicians, full of energy.

meanings.definition: A first course of a meal.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant's starters included soup and salad options.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy the starters more than the main course.
meanings.sent3: The starters at the dinner party disappeared quickly.
meanings.sent4: The starters were like a preview of the delicious meal to come.
meanings.sent5: The starters were so tasty that I almost filled up on them alone.

meanings.definition: A device used to start an engine.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic checked the starters in the car to ensure they were working.
meanings.sent2: The old truck needed a new set of starters to turn on.
meanings.sent3: The starters in the boat engine needed replacement after years of use.
meanings.sent4: The starters in the generator were crucial during the power outage.
meanings.sent5: The starters in the lawnmower made it easy to begin yard work.

meanings.definition: A player in a sports game who starts the game.
meanings.sent1: The coach announced the starters for the basketball game.
meanings.sent2: Being one of the starters in the soccer match was a great honor.
meanings.sent3: The starters on the football team were determined to win the game.
meanings.sent4: The starters in the baseball game had been practicing hard all week.
meanings.sent5: The starters in the volleyball match were ready to spike and serve.
